cloud.name: iNET / Internet
cloud.notes: Decent pricing and wide spectrum offerings.

cloud.name: Getspace
cloud.notes: VPS is too expensive, but they've got some cool other services. You can easily sign up and get 50GB drive space free.

cloud.name: Resellers Panel
cloud.notes: Nothing to see in terms of VPS, but there is an intriguing data hosting plan with "Unlimited SSD Storage, 100 E-mail Accounts, Ulimited Monthly Traffic" for $2.50/mo.

cloud.name: TIME4VPS
cloud.notes: Entry VPS option would be a better deal if they didn't encrease the price at renewal. However, their 1.49 EUR/mo. 'Storage VPS' plan looks stellar. It notably offers 256GB of storage and 2TB of bandwidth along with a tiny bit of CPU and RAM so it does seem to be a full VPS.

cloud.name: HeroHosty
cloud.notes: Their VPS offerings are too expensive, but their entry level 'Shared Hosting' and 'Cloud Hosting' packages are cheap (around the ~$1.00 mark) so that might be useful. I can't desirn their restrictions.

cloud.name: Timeweb
cloud.notes: Good pricing on VPS.

cloud.name: KRYSTAL
cloud.notes: Prices aren't what we are looking for but the company seems just fabulous. They are 100% green energy powered and human centric. If you've got a little extra money then definitely consider this company.

cloud.name: VIRMACH
cloud.notes: Good and to the point. VPS starting at $1/mo.

cloud.name: HOSTENS
cloud.notes: Competitively priced VPS and VPS storage with good value. Both need to be reserved for 3 years to get best value. VPS: $1.80/mo for 20GB disk, 4TB bandwidth, 2GB RAM. VPS Storage: 256GB disk, 2TB badnwith. In about they show their team and operation and looks good. Countainter VPS is priced at $1.20/mo, but it is questionable since it offers half the bandwidth and slower processors.

cloud.name: frantech
cloud.notes: Frantech offers a couple of cheap and very high value VPS services hosted in America and Luxembourg. All of their VPSs are powered by next-gen Ryzen 3900X CPUs. The initial VPS offering is priced at $2/mo and is a great value given it's features. Notably it comes with 10GB NVME storage, an IPv4 address + /48 IPv6 and relatively high unmetered bandwidth. Frantech additionally offers an attachable block storage service. For $1.25/mo you add an additional 256GB storage to your VPS or buy even more if you like. Frantech is seemingly the highest value service I've come across so far.

cloud.name: vHost
cloud.notes: Best price/deal I've found so far in Vietnam.

cloud.name: AZDIGI
cloud.notes: Cheapest offering is out of stock, but pricing is competitive especially if they offer long term reservations for that initial offering.

cloud.name: NHANHOA
cloud.notes: Seemingly competitive pricing.

cloud.name: BKNS
cloud.notes: Decent pricing.

cloud.name: HOSTVN
cloud.notes: Good reserved pricing starting at 2,835,000 VND for 3 years.

cloud.name: vinahost
cloud.notes: Company looks good with decent pricing and a wide offering of services. Investigating to see what there long term reservation options are.

cloud.name: BIZMAC
cloud.notes: Supports Alma, Fedora, Gentoo, Mint, Suse and BSD. Pricing isn't so good.

cloud.name: HOSTINGVIET
cloud.notes: VPS: 3900k VND for 5 year reservation.

cloud.name: DIGISTAR
cloud.notes: Interesting VoIP call server service.; they have data services that are innaccesible via bottons.

cloud.name: VDATA
cloud.notes: 3060k VND for 3 year reservation. Site has general knowledge resources.

cloud.name: panzura
cloud.description: They offer a new and supposedly innovative global cloud/internet file system service primarily to replace local NAS in a typical org.
cloud.notes: they seem to be a sort of mega consultant to large companies

cloud.name: PAVIETNAM.VN
cloud.notes: decent price/performance and memory ratio

cloud.name: LONG VAN SYSTEM
cloud.notes: Only option we resonably priced cloud storage that I've found in Vietnam.

cloud.name: BKHOST
cloud.notes: decent perks for reservations

cloud.name: TINOHOST

cloud.notes: they seriously throttle traffic in and out of Vietnam

cloud.name: Vietnam VPS
cloud.notes: Pride themselves on being all Vietnamese and providing english support.

cloud.name: SHOCK HOSTING
cloud.notes: They offer 30GB SSD or 300GB HDD.

cloud.name: NEXUS BYTES

cloud.name: vpsdime
cloud.notes: seem to have good prices on storage and compute; they however seem to by discontinued

cloud.name: GOZEN HOST

cloud.name: securedragon
cloud.notes: these guys seem cheap practical and transparent. they even allow you to test their network at drgn.biz before buying.

cloud.name: WSWD

good deal on memories

cloud.name: Prgmr
cloud.notes: I like it. They say 'We don't assume you are stupid. Since 2005.' and they let you run arch.
website is being badly translated but seems like a potentially good deal
good value. $7 gets you 2 cores, 8GB RAM, 200GB SSD and notably 32TB Traffic / 'Unlimited Incoming'
you can pay with Bitcoin
low introductory and good network specs
high 20+ bandwidth
cheap vps option with TONS of network capacity but storage is expensive
cheap with good bandwidth. they accept bitcoin and open all ports
20TB bandwidth
potentially fast network speed
good network
they have a center in Fremont California and offer raspberry pi colocation, ip tunneling and more for decent prices. their VPS options seem reasonable except they're missing storage.
tons of services and they even offer free raspberry pi's to local businesses
